sub_title: Researcher, Lecturer and Consultant on Sustainable Governance Strategies
summary:
I am a versatile professional with a variety of experiences, skills and interests. These include Urban Strategist, Political Scientist, Urban Innovation Consultant, PhD Researcher in Waste Governance, Motivational Speaker, Organisational Advisor, Futsal Player and Public Policy and Leadership Lecturer. I am originally from Paraguay and completed my studies in Norway, the USA, Taiwan, Australia and The Netherlands. 

Currently, I focus on training and mentoring 200+ international students to become the next generation of public leaders. I combine this role with insights from my PhD research on urban governance. Occasionally, I am open to consulting jobs and other professional projects. 

Previously, I was Vice-minister of The National Council of Science and Technology, Green Climate Fund Focal Point and The United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III) Official Delegate of Paraguay. 

I have also co-founded and directed two consulting companies and two non-profit organizations from where I led many SDGs related consulting, development and research projects for the Paraguayan Ministry of Planning, UNDP, UN Global Compact Network, World Bank, UNEP, Inter-American Development Bank, WFP, CAF, Avina Foundation, Paraguayan Sustainable Cities Network, and companies in the Education, Energy, Food and Health industries. Among these, I spearheaded projects worth over EUR 250 million. 

I was invited as a guest speaker on various occasions, including Harvard University (USA), The Hertie School of Governance (Germany), INCAE Business School (Costa Rica) and TEDx Conferences. I share all these experiences with students and clients to build a network of global leaders committed to sustainability.

Latest academic publication: The effectiveness of inter-municipal cooperation on waste management outcomes: A case study in Ecuador: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.wasman.2022.07.008

treasury_media.title: From Paraguay to the Netherlands: a journey of growth and international cooperation
treasury_media.description: Mario Villalba Ferreira defended his master thesis on Inter-Municipal Cooperation this past November at the Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies. Weeks after his defence, he started on his PhD research at IHS and the Erasmus Graduate School of Social Sciences and Humanities. Although he is just at the beginning of his doctoral trajectory, he has recently been invited to give lectures both at Harvard University in the USA and at the Hertie School of Governance in Berlin.

treasury_media.title: Desantando Innovaciones Urbanas en Paraguay. Reflexiones desde Harvard.
treasury_media.description: El 12 y 13 de abril se realizó la Paraguay Conference 2019 en la Universidad de Harvard.  Los organizadores eligieron los temas más relevantes para el futuro del Paraguay, entre ellos inclusión social, desarrollo económico inclusivo, desarrollo sustentable e innovaciones urbanas.

treasury_media.title: Bañadenses se mudan al World Trade Center por Mario Villalba Ferreira
treasury_media.description: Las recientes inundaciones generaron un montón de posturas que ameritan un debate profundo sobre nuestras políticas de vivienda e inclusión social. Entender el fenómeno de migración hacia las ciudades es clave para que podamos abrirnos a plantear proyectos disruptivos que en principio parecerán absurdos como ocurre con toda gran innovación.

treasury_media.title: ¿Qué vas a hacer los próximos 15 años de tu vida? - Económico - ABC Color
treasury_media.description: Si todavía no hiciste planes, te invito a que te sumes a un grupo de jóvenes profesionales en la creación de un Paraguay inclusivo, justo, próspero y sustentable.

treasury_media.title: 8 Acciones para construir ciudades sustentables
treasury_media.description: Crecimiento económico, inclusión social, estabilidad política y sostenibilidad ambiental. Estas son las características de las ciudades sustentables. Así lo precisó Mario Villalba, co-fundador de Conciencia Consultora y doctorando- por el programa de Becas Carlos Antonio López- en Desarrollo Urbano y Gestión de Ciudades de la Universidad Erasmus de Rotterdam, Países Bajos.

treasury_media.title: Preparan proyecto a favor del ambiente y la reducción de la pobreza
treasury_media.description: La Secretaría Técnica de Planificación del Desarrollo Económico y Social (STP), miembro de la Comisión Nacional de Cambio Climático y desde su rol de Autoridad Nacional Designada ante el Fondo Verde del Clima, prepara un  proyecto sobre pobreza, reforestación, energía y cambio climático, que sería presentado ante el Fondo Verde del Clima.

treasury_media.title: El que emprende para transformar su ciudad... | Mario Villalba | TEDxINCAE
treasury_media.description: El que emprende para transformar su ciudad, logra que la ciudad transforme al mundo.

treasury_media.title: Gramo / Mario Villalba / La Importancia de la Ciudad Sustentable
treasury_media.description: Mario Villalba, Director Ejecutivo del Movimiento Asunción Nos Une, nos habla de la transición inevitable que tenemos que hacer entre la ciudad que tenemos hoy y una ciudad sustentable. Charla realizada en Setiembre, 2012.

treasury_media.title: FONDO VERDE DEL CLIMA: OPORTUNIDAD PARA FINANCIAR EL DESARROLLO SUSTENTABLE
treasury_media.description: FONDO VERDE DEL CLIMA: OPORTUNIDAD PARA FINANCIAR EL DESARROLLO SUSTENTABLE LIC. MARIO VILLALBA FERREIRA PUNTO FOCAL TÉCNICO DE PARAGUAY ANTE EL FONDO VERDE DEL CLIMA.

profile_positions.description: Researcher of the Future Urban Systems research group on "inter-municipal governance models for circular waste management in sustainable cities."
profile_positions.title: Researcher

company.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Teaching and mentoring 200+ Dutch and international students to become the next generation of public leaders. After a successful accreditation in 2023 of an innovative curriculum I co-designed, the International Public Policy & Leadership programme at the Faculty of Public Management, Law and Safety, trains students on Advising on Policy, Advocacy Strategy, Programme Evaluation, Organisation and Management and Project-Based Working. 

Additionally, I have been elected as the chair of the BO/IPPL Programme Committee (equivalent to staff and student council) since 2022.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer of Public Policy and Leadership

profile_positions.description:
I am a PhD Researcher affiliated to The Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies (IHS), which is an international education, advisory and research centre of Erasmus University Rotterdam, part of the School of Economics (ESE) and the Faculty of Social Sciences (FSS).

The main specialisations and expertise areas at IHS include: land development, infrastructure, environment and climate change, housing and livelihoods, planning and strategies, competitiveness and resilience.

My research focuses on understanding the link between inter-municipal cooperation and sustainable waste management in Latin America.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate & Researcher

profile_positions.description:
* Designed and spearheaded a national civil society network for sustainables cities in 24 paraguayan municipalities.
* Directed and co-organized the first "Foro Internacional Ciudades Sustentables" in Asunción, Paraguay on July 27th, 2013.
* Directed, designed and edited PANORAMA: a magazine portraying statistics, academic articles, interviews, panoramic pictures, info-graphics, drawings and other content relevant to easily understanding the quality of living in Paraguayan cities. 
* Created the concept of the three "Is": "Inspirar, Informar e Incidir" as a three process model for effective civic participation for the implementation of innovative public policies.   
* Currently advising on new projects to strengthen the network for sustainable cities in Paraguay and enhance its financial sustainability and political and social impact.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Advisor and Former Executive Director

profile_positions.description: I provided consulting services as a waste management and climate change expert to 11 municipalities in the metropolitan area of Asuncion (AMA). I assisted the municipalities in developing their waste management plans, inter-municipal strategies, climate change mitigation and adaptation policies, risk management and their Territorial and Urban Planning - Planes de Ordenamiento Urbano y Territorial (POUT). I also coordinated the Climate Change, Risk Management, Governance and Waste Management Modules in the course entitled: "Planning and Regulation of Metropolitan Territorial Development", offered to 40 civil servants (directors, advisors) from 11 municipalities in the AMA.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer and Waste Management and Climate Change Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The Global Shapers Community is a network of Hubs developed and led by young people who are exceptional in their potential, their achievements and their drive to make a contribution to their communities.
An Initiative of the World Economic Forum.

I am one of the founding shapers of the Asuncion Hub.
profile_positions.title: Global Shaper

Official STP representative to CONACYT- National Council of Science and Technology

Advisor to CONACYT on major national Science and Technology policies, programs and projects. 

Member of the Programs and Projects and Communications committees. 

Official CONACYT representative to CONCULTURA - National Council of Culture.
profile_positions.title: Vice Minister

company.name: Secretaría Técnica de Planificación del Desarrollo Económico y Social

profile_positions.description:
Assessing the Minister of Planning (STP) Cabinet and the Public Policy Analisis Unit in key policy and institutional decisions. 

Official Representative before the National Council of Science and Technology (CONACYT: http://www.conacyt.gov.py/)

Official Representative before the National Comission of Environment (CONAM)

Official Representative before the National Comission of Climate Change (CNCC).
 
Technical Focal Point before the Green Climate Fund. Serving as nexus between Paraguayan government and the Green Climate Fund (http://www.greenclimate.fund/home) to set up the National Designated Authority office for GCF and develop a pipeline of green projects.  

Advisor to Becas Carlos Antonio Lopez (http://www.becal.gov.py/) program. The first nationally funded scholarship program for post-graduate studies in the world´s top 300 universities. 

Co-creating Paraguay's 1st center for social innovation within government.
 
Co-creator of Paraguay's 1st national youth service program, AROVIA Paraguay in collaboration with 6 government ministries and the President's office; Developed strategic partnerships with international cooperation including Peace Corps, Servicio País program in Chile & Innovations in Civic Participation; Spearheaded national partnerships with Paraguayan universities, civil society organizations and businesses; Established policy frameworks to position volunteerism and civic service as tools for development in accordance with the President's National Development Plan for 2014-2030.

Co-led initiatives to improve work place culture and internal communication,
including work climate surveys, focus groups and a teambuilding workshop for the 120 employees and 100 contractors of the Secretariat.

Senior Advisor to Paraguayan National Development Plan for 2014-2030 and the Poverty Reduction Plan "Harvesting Opportunities" (Sembrando Oportunidades).
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor
